Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents a player and it stores necessary information about their identity, answers and overall actions when playing the game.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int bet  
      private long clickTime  
      private java.lang.String nickname
      Each player has a: score: is the sum of the player's points status: depending on the players answer is either true or false (correct, not correct) clickTime: stores the milliseconds from the moment the question appears until the player answers bet: is used when playing Bet and stores the amount that the player bet myThread: is used to make the player class serializable in order to be able to store a player object in a file streak: is used in the Thermometer round and stores the number of correct questions answered.
      private int score  
      private boolean status  
      private int streak  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Player()
      Constructor with no given variable for damage control, it initializes the variables.
      Player​(java.lang.String nickname)
      Creates a player with the given string and initializes all the variables that will be needed in the course of the game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void defaultifyBet()
      The player's bet is initialized to zero.
      void defaultifyStatus()
      The player's status is initialized to false.
      void defaultifyStreak()
      Returns the streak to its default value, which is zero.
      int getBet()  
      long getClickTime()  
      java.lang.String getNickname()  
      int getScore()

      int getStreak()  
      void increaseScoreBy​(int newPoints)
      Increases the score of the player by a given amount of new points.
      void increaseStreak()
      This method increases the players streak by one.
      void setBet​(int bet)  
      void setClickTime​(long time)  
      void setNickname​(java.lang.String nickname)

      • nickname

        private java.lang.String nickname
        Each player has a: score: is the sum of the player's points status: depending on the players answer is either true or false (correct, not correct) clickTime: stores the milliseconds from the moment the question appears until the player answers bet: is used when playing Bet and stores the amount that the player bet myThread: is used to make the player class serializable in order to be able to store a player object in a file streak: is used in the Thermometer round and stores the number of correct questions answered.
